official-title.#text: To authorize the Administrator of General Services to convey a parcel of real property in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the
sponsor.#text: Ms. Michelle Lujan Grisham of New Mexico

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

quote.#tail: means the real property located in Albuquerque, New Mexico, that, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , subject to survey, generally consists of lots 12 through 19, and for the westerly boundary, the portion of either lot 19 or 20 which is the outside west wall of the basement level of the Old Post Office building, and which has a municipal address of 123 Fourth Street, SW., in Block 18, New Mexico Town Company’s Original Townsite, Albuquerque, New Mexico.

quote.#tail: means the Amy Biehl High School Foundation.

header.#text: Conveyance of real property in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to the Amy Biehl High School Foundation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall offer to convey to the Foundation, by quitclaim deed, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the Federal land.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require the Foundation to pay to the
consideration in an amount equal to the fair market value of the Federal land, as determined based on an appraisal that is acceptable to the Administrator.

text.#text: As consideration for conveyance of the Federal land under
The Foundation shall be responsible for paying—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:b

text.#text: the costs of an appraisal conducted under
any other costs relating to the conveyance of the Federal land under this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be paid into the Federal Buildings Fund established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:b
Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:d/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , in amounts specified in appropriations Acts, for expenditure for any lawful purpose consistent with existing authorities granted to the
, except that the Administrator shall provide to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: 30 days advance written notice of any expenditure of the proceeds.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate

text.#text: Amounts paid into the Federal Buildings Fund under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may require that any conveyance under
be subject to such additional terms and conditions as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Albuquerque, New Mexico, Federal Land Conveyance Act of 2014/s:3/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: considers appropriate to protect the interests of the United States.

text.#text: The conveyance of the Federal land under this Act shall occur not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act.
